recipe_name: Asian-style pulled pork with spicy slaw
author: Lorraine Pascale
method: Preheat the oven to 150C/130C Fan/Gas 2. For the pork, put the soy sauce, chilli powder, Chinese five-spice, sugar, garlic and ginger in a large bowl. Mix together to make a sloppy paste.  Put the pork in a deep roasting tray and massage the paste over the meat. Cover with foil and cook for 8–10 hours, or until the meat is so tender you can shred it with a fork. Just before serving, make the slaw. Mix the sesame oil and soy sauce together in a large bowl. Add the cabbage, onion, carrot, chilli and coriander. Toss together until well mixed. Season to taste with pepper. Once the pork is ready, shred it with a fork. Serve it piled into toasted sesame buns with a smear of mayonnaise and the spicy slaw.
ingredients: 5 tbsp soy sauce ,  4 tbsp chilli powder,  3 tbsp Chinese five-spice powder ,  2 tbsp light muscavado sugar ,  2 garlic cloves, finely chopped,  4cm/1½in fresh root ginger, peeled and finely chopped,  3kg/6lb 8oz boneless pork shoulder, rind removed,  3 tbsp sesame oil ,  2 tbsp soy sauce,  ½ red cabbage, very thinly sliced,  1 red onion, finely chopped,  1 large carrot, cut into thin matchsticks,  2 red chillies, finely chopped (seeds removed if you prefer less heat),  handful coriander leaves (optional),  black pepper,  150g/5½oz mayonnaise,  10-12 sesame seed buns, split open and toasted
